title: What is a finite type invariants?
content: IntroductionIn some sense, finite type invariants are “polynomials” over the linear span of all knots. One way to define a polynomial of degree $n$ over a field $\mathbb R$ is to say its $n$-th derivative identically vanishes, and if we are working with something n...
